alert.note: Alert for Boone (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:11PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN BOONE AND NORTHWESTERN HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 610 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Bridgetown, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, North College Hill, Cheviot, Cleves, Shawnee, Taylor Creek, Bridgetown, Monfort Heights, Miami Heights, Mack, Dry Ridge, Grandview, Addyston, North Bend, Dent, Francisville, Covedale, Groesbeck, White Oak and Hebron. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 10 and 19. I-75 in Ohio near mile marker 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
